FuncDef:
The mpls rsvp-te timer retransmission command sets retransmission parameters.
The undo mpls rsvp-te timer retransmission command disables retransmission.
By default, the increment value is 1, and the interval is 5000 milliseconds.
CLIs: mpls rsvp-te timer retransmission { increment-value <incvalue> | retransmit-value <retvalue> } *
undo mpls rsvp-te timer retransmission increment-value
undo mpls rsvp-te timer retransmission retransmit-value

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the retransmission incremental value and the timeout period of a retransmission timer.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.

Specifies the srefresh message retransmission interval.
The value is an integer ranging from 500 to 5000, in milliseconds.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-mpls] mpls rsvp-te timer retransmission retransmit-value 500 increment-value 2
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Next retransmission interval = Current retransmission interval x (1 + Incremental value).
Prerequisites
The Srefresh mechanism has been enabled by running the mpls rsvp-te srefresh command in the MPLS view.
